channel.title: Running servers on Unix
channel.description:
Hi folks, I've been looking around for topic dealing with query however I was unable to find a topic that answers my problem. I have a VPS and I have Java up and running and I have manage to run other applications using the Java on my server. So I know Java itself isn't the problem. :P It's more or less the lack of my knowledge. :P I've installed Java in the following path: /home/admin/jdk1.6.0_11/ Now my only problem is running the server I'm aware that batch files don't run on unix and I also know that there's no Java variables set. On windows the Run batch file contains:
@echo off title Shift cd bin java -Xmx1024m -cp .;mysql.jar org.reenscape.Server pause
So I imagined since I don't have a variable in place I would have to do something of the following? In the Java bin folder do: ./java /home/admin/MyRSServer/bin -cp .;mysql.jar org.reenscape.Server But I think I'm doing it wrong? Help would be appreciated. :P

item.title: Running servers on Unix
item.dc:creator: @The_cook_from_runesc The cook from runescape
item.description:
@The_cook_from_runesc wrote:

You don’t tend to need a variable or absolute directory set on *nix systems, the binaries are usually put in your default binary path. java should “just work” as long as it’s properly installed.

Just type the commands java and javac to see what they return.

Read full topic

item.title: Running servers on Unix
item.dc:creator: @EwfsPrince EwfsPrince
item.description:
@EwfsPrince wrote:

Hi folks,

I’ve been looking around for topic dealing with query however I was unable to find a topic that answers my problem. I have a VPS and I have Java up and running and I have manage to run other applications using the Java on my server. So I know Java itself isn’t the problem.
It’s more or less the lack of my knowledge.

I’ve installed Java in the following path: /home/admin/jdk1.6.0_11/
Now my only problem is running the server I’m aware that batch files don’t run on unix and I also know that there’s no Java variables set.

On windows the Run batch file contains:

@echo off title Shift cd bin java -Xmx1024m -cp .;mysql.jar org.reenscape.Server pause

So I imagined since I don’t have a variable in place I would have to do something of the following?

In the Java bin folder do: ./java /home/admin/MyRSServer/bin -cp .;mysql.jar org.reenscape.Server

But I think I’m doing it wrong?

Help would be appreciated.

Read full topic
